activities.title: Pottery Workshop
activities.description:
Have you ever tried a Pottery Workshop?

Unleash your creativity and get your hands dirty in Georgia!

Whether you're a beginner or just looking for a fun activity, shaping clay into ceramics is an unforgettable experience.

📍 Visit Ceramic Studio Tbilisi (14 Ioane Shavteli St, Tbilisi) for beginner-friendly classes.

🎓 Student discount: Present your TBC or Bank of Georgia student card at arrival for 30% off!

Book now and enjoy a creative day out! ✨

activities.title: Photography Walks
activities.description:
Ever wanted to see Tbilisi through a photographer's lens?

Join our Photography Walks and capture the soul of the city! From hidden courtyards to panoramic views, discover angles even locals miss.

📍 Meet at Freedom Square fountain every Saturday at 10 AM

🎓 Flash your student ID (any bank) for 25% off the walk fee!

No fancy camera? No problem – smartphone shooters welcome too! 📸

activities.title: Writing Retreat
activities.description:
Dream of writing your novel surrounded by Georgian mountains?

Our Writing Retreat gives you the perfect escape! Morning inspiration sessions, quiet writing hours, and sunset feedback circles.

📍 Kakheti Vineyard Estate (transport included from Tbilisi)

🎓 Students write free! Just show your ID for complimentary coffee refills ☕

First-timer? Try our Saturday trial session – no commitment! ✍️

activities.title: Museum Pass
activities.description:
Tired of paying separately at every museum door?

Get our Museum Pass and explore Georgia's treasures stress-free! Unlimited access for 7 days to 12 top cultural spots.

📍 Pick up at any participating museum

🎓 Exclusive student price: Just show your TBC/BoG card for 40% savings!

Pro tip: The pass includes free metro rides on museum days! 🚇

discounts.title: Café Beanland
discounts.description:
Need a caffeine boost during exams?

Enjoy 20% off all drinks at Café Beanland – the coziest study spot in Tbilisi!

📍 22 Rustaveli Ave (near metro station)

🎓 Extra perk: Show your student ID after 5 PM for a free cookie with any coffee! 🍪

Try their famous honey latte – it's life-changing! ☕

discounts.title: GrillSpot
discounts.description:
Hungry after class? We've got you covered!

Get FREE fries with every burger at GrillSpot – home of Georgia's juiciest patties!

📍 5 Vake Street (open until 2 AM)

🎓 Student special: Upgrade to cheesy fries for just ¥1 with your ID! 🧀

Pro tip: Their spicy adjika sauce is legendary – ask for extra! 🌶️

discounts.title: Urban Style
discounts.description:
Time for a wardrobe upgrade?

Score 15% off everything at Urban Style – where Georgian tradition meets streetwear!

📍 Galleria Mall, 3rd floor

🎓 Students get DOUBLE discount days every Wednesday! 👕👖

New collection alert: Limited-edition Tbilisi graphic teases in stock! 🎨

discounts.title: StudySpace
discounts.description:
Study marathon ahead?

Fuel up with BOGO coffee at StudySpace – silent zones & superfast WiFi included!

📍 17 Chavchavadze Ave (24/7 during exams)

🎓 Flash your student card for free notebook and pen with any purchase! 📓

Bonus: Unlimited free refills on filter coffee! ♾️

jobs.title: Brand Ambassador
jobs.description:
Love promoting cool brands?

Earn €12/hour as a Brand Ambassador for student-friendly companies!

📍 Flexible locations across Tbilisi

🎓 Bonus: Free product samples + networking opportunities

Perfect for communications/marketing students! 💼

jobs.title: Content Creator
jobs.description:
Got social media skills?

Create content for local businesses at €15/hour - portfolio building included!

📍 Remote or in-office options

🎓 Student advantage: Equipment provided if needed

Ideal for photography/film students! 🎥

jobs.title: Online Tutoring
jobs.description:
Strong in academics?

Teach fellow students online at €18/hour - set your own schedule!

📍 Fully remote

🎓 Priority for STEM subjects (Math/Physics especially needed)

Great for grad students! 📚

jobs.title: Event Staff
jobs.description:
Enjoy vibrant events?

Work at concerts/festivals as Event Staff for €14/hour + free entry!

📍 Various venues in Tbilisi

🎓 Night shift bonus for student workers

Best way to earn while having fun! 🎪

leisure_discounts.title: Bike Rentals
leisure_discounts.description:
Want to explore Tbilisi on two wheels?

Get 30% off bike rentals all week long!

📍 Pickup stations near all major universities

🎓 Extra hour free with student ID

Helmets and locks included! 🚲

leisure_discounts.title: Cinema Tickets
leisure_discounts.description:
Movie night on a budget?

50% off cinema tickets every Wednesday!

📍 All major theaters included

🎓 Free popcorn when you show student card

English subtitles available! 🎬

leisure_discounts.title: Yoga Retreat
leisure_discounts.description:
Need stress relief?

€50 gets you a 2-day yoga retreat in the mountains!

📍 Shuttle from Tbilisi included

🎓 Meditation workshop free for students

Mats and meals provided! 🧘

leisure_discounts.title: Travel Deals
leisure_discounts.description:
Planning a getaway?

25% off group trips to Batumi, Kazbegi & more!

📍 Departures near campuses

🎓 Student-only departure times available

Perfect for weekend adventures! ✈️

handy_work.title: Furniture Assembly
handy_work.description:
IKEA furniture defeating you?

Get expert assembly help for €25/hour!

📍 All Tbilisi areas covered

🎓 Student special: First 30 mins free!

Tools included - no stress! 🔧

handy_work.title: Electrical Repairs
handy_work.description:
Flickering lights?

Certified electricians available for €30/hour

📍 Same-day service available

🎓 Student housing discounts

All repairs guaranteed! 💡

handy_work.title: Painting Services
handy_work.description:
Dorm room needs color?

Professional painting for €50/room

📍 Eco-friendly paints available

🎓 Group discount for whole apartments

Leave the mess to us! 🎨

handy_work.title: Moving Help
handy_work.description:
Changing apartments?

Strong helpers for €20/hour

📍 Includes transport assistance

🎓 Free boxes for students

We handle heavy lifting! 📦

news.title: Free Pizza Fridays Launched Near Ilia State University
news.description:
Great news for hungry students! Starting this Friday, Campus Kitchen (located just 200m from Ilia State's main campus) will host **Free Pizza Fridays** – a new initiative sponsored by five local pizzerias to support students during exam season.

From 12:00 to 15:00 every Friday, present your student ID at the counter to claim a free slice of margherita or Georgian-inspired adjika pizza. Vegan options will be available upon request. The program will run through June, with plans to extend based on participation.

'We remember our student days,' says organizer Gigi Beridze of Beridze Pizzeria. 'This is our way of giving back and maybe discovering future regular customers!' 

📍 Where: Campus Kitchen, 3 Sandro Euli St
⏰ When: Fridays 12:00-15:00 (while supplies last)
🎓 Bonus: Show a TBC/Bank of Georgia student card to enter a raffle for free whole pizzas!

news.title: New Museum of Digital Arts Opens in Tbilisi
news.description:
Tbilisi's art scene gets a tech upgrade with yesterday's grand opening of **MODE** (Museum of Digital Experiences) on Aghmashenebeli Avenue. This cutting-edge space blends Georgian artistic traditions with immersive technology across 15 interactive exhibits.

Students can enjoy:
- 50% off admission with ID
- Free VR workshops every Thursday
- A 'Digital Supra' exhibit where AI generates traditional feast scenes

The museum's highlight is the 'Tbilisi Through Time' tunnel, using augmented reality to show how the city evolved from the 12th century to 2125. 'We want students to see tech as creative tool,' says curator Nina Chkheidze.

Special student nights with live coding performances will begin May 15th.

📍 Address: 45 Aghmashenebeli Ave
🕒 Hours: 11:00-20:00 (closed Tuesdays)
🎓 Pro tip: Computer science/art students get free entry during finals week!

news.title: Bus Line #87 Suspended After Student-Led Protest
news.description:
Following a week of student protests over unreliable service, Tbilisi Transport Company has temporarily suspended Bus #87 (Saburtalo-University route) until May 10th for 'system upgrades.'

The decision came after 300+ students staged a 'Books Not Brakes' sit-in at the bus depot, highlighting chronic issues:
- 68% late arrivals last semester
- Overcrowding during peak hours
- Frequent breakdowns

Alternative arrangements:
🚌 Temporary Route #87A with extra buses
🚇 Free metro transfers with student ID
🛴 Discounted Bolt scooters near affected stops

Student council representative Mariam Lortkipanidze says negotiations continue: 'We won't accept token improvements – we need dedicated student transport solutions.'

📢 Next protest: May 5th at Freedom Square
💡 Compensation: Affected students can claim 10 free taxi vouchers at their university admin office.

news.title: Student Political Representation Gains Momentum
news.description:
A coalition of Tbilisi student groups has launched the **'Our Seat at the Table'** campaign, demanding formal youth representation in Parliament. The movement gained traction after last month's education budget cuts.

Key proposals include:
- A dedicated Student Affairs Committee
- Voting rights for university councils on education policies
- 5 reserved parliamentary seats for under-30 representatives

'Decisions about our future are made without us,' says Ilia State law student Luka Tsiklauri. Over 8,000 students have signed the petition in two weeks.

The campaign will host open debates:
🗓 May 8th: TSU Auditorium #5 (18:00)
🗓 May 12th: Free University Campus (16:30)

Opposition MP Salome Samadashvili has pledged support, calling it 'the most organized youth initiative in a decade.'

✊ How to help: Volunteer at info booths on Rustaveli Ave
